results.title: Thunderbirds are go
results.creator_credit: David Lane, Sylvia Anderson and Associated Television (Overseas) Ltd
results.brief_description: The Tracy team launch a highly dangerous rescue mission in space in this first feature-length Thunderbirds classic. SZero X, a 21st century spacecraft, is suddenly blasted by a strange explosion as it leaves the Earth’s atmosphere bound for Mars. Is it sabotage? Can the Thunderbirds discover the perpetrators and save the next launch? This adventure film is gadget loaded and features visual effects by Derek Meddings as well as sound effects by some of London’s famous rock stars, including Cliff Richards.

results.title: GI blues
results.creator_credit: Norman Taurog, Hal B. Wallis and Paramount Pictures
results.brief_description: Elvis plays a singing GI, stationed in West Germany who has plans for life after the Army; opening a nightclub back home. The only problem is that he’s a bit short of cash and must take part in a wager to raise sufficient funds. The bet: he must melt the iceberg heart of a willowy cabaret dancer (Juliet Prowse). Complications arise when he begins to fall for her, and trouble can only ensue when she discovers the bet. Features the following songs: “GI Blues”, “Tonight is so right for love”, “Wooden heart” and “Blue suede shoes”. Cast includes Elvis Presley, Juliet Prowse, Robert Ives and Leticia Roman.

results.title: Hard target
results.creator_credit: John Woo, Sean Daniel, James Jacks, Renaissance Productions and Alphaville
results.brief_description: Chance Boudreaux (Jean Claude Van Damme) is a down on his luck Cajun soldier, reluctantly hired by Nat Binder (Yancy Butler) to help find her father, an ex Green Beret who is currently homeless in Louisiana. What they both don’t know is that their mission is doomed to fail, as Nat’s father has been brutally murdered as sport. His killer is the ruthless Fouchon (Lance Henriksen), a mercenary who procures homeless people living around New Orleans and enlists them in his game, whereby they become the live targets. This film features enough of John Woo’s trademark action and Jean Claude Van Damme’s physical presence to satisy Woo and JCVD fans.

results.title: Halloween
results.creator_credit: John Carpenter, Debra Hill and Falcon Film
results.brief_description: John Carpenter’s much imitated ‘Halloween’ defined the eighties stalk and slash genre, spawning inferior copies like the ‘Friday the 13th’ series (including six sequels of it’s own), and for a time making star Jamie Lee Curtis into the premium “scream queen”. Later on the conventions of the genre were cleverly re-invented for a nineties audience by director Wes Craven and writer Kevin Williamson in ‘Scream’, which pays direct homage to ‘Halloween’. John Carpenter opens his film with an unnerving point of view shot of the young psychotic Michael Myers brutally stabbing his teenage sister to death on Halloween night. Flash forward to Halloween 15 years later and Michael has escaped the mental institution he has been locked up in. Meanwhile shy, virginal teenager Laurie Strode (Jamie Lee Curtis) and her girlfriends are preparing for Halloween, unaware of the menace that lurks in their quiet suburban community. Carpenter makes great use of the sparse, atmospheric music score (which he also composed), and uses to maximum creepy effect the white mask Michael Myers wears throughout the film. The film also established the classic horror genre rule- if your a sexually active teenager, you die! Cast also includes Donald Pleasence, P.J. Soles, Tony Moran.

results.title: Kids (D)
results.creator_credit: Larry Clark, Cary Woods, Gus Van Sant, Patrick Panzarella, Michael Chambers, Leigh Blake, Excalibur Films, Independent Pictures and Miramax Films
results.brief_description: ‘Kids’ is a shocking movie representing an underground youth culture of excess and liberty to the extreme in an inner-city urban habitat. The viewer is taken on a 24-hour urban jaunt, alluding to amoral grit and an excessive depiction of nihilistic youth as a sensationalized pseudo-documentary. The film focuses on freckled boy Telly (Leo Fitzpatrick), whose idea of safe sex is to only have sex with virgins. His theory is disproven when a girl from one of his past unprotected passions tests positive to HIV. Cast includes Leo Fitzpatrick (Telly), Sarah Henderson (Girl #1), Justin Pierce (Casper) and Joseph Chan (Deli Owner). Written by Larry Clark, Leo Fitzpatrick and Jim Lewis. Peter Bici, Jeff Pang, Harold Hunter, and many others from the movie are professional skateboarders on the Zoo York team.

results.title: The Wings of the dove
results.creator_credit: Iain Softley, David Parfitt, Stephen Evans, Renaissance Dove and Miramax Films
results.brief_description: When Kate (Helena Bonham-Carter) falls in love with middle class journalist Martin (Linus Roache), her benefactor Aunt refuses to accept their union, believing her niece can do better. She offers Kate an ultimatum, stay with her lover and renounce any financial support for herself and her father, or assume her rightful place in society and promise to never see him again. Months later, an American heiress, Millie (Alison Elliot), enters their milieu and Kate forms a friendship with the new visitor. When Kate discovers that Millie is not only rich, but dying, her mind toys with the possibility of finding a way that she and Martin can be together and financially successful- Martin must fall in love with Millie. Set in Venice in the early 1900’s, this lavish period drama is based on the novel by Henry James. Cast includes Elizabeth McGovern, Charlotte Rampling and Michael Gambon.

results.title: Honey, I shrunk the kids
results.creator_credit: Joe Johnston, Penney Finkelman Cox and Buena Vista Pictures
results.brief_description: A non-stop comedy adventure starring Rick Moranis as a preoccupied inventor who has created an electro-magnetic shrinking machine that is accidentally activated and shrinks his children to a minuscule size. After they are caught in the garbage and thrown outside, a visually innovative action packed adventure ensues as the children journey through their backyard and encounter attacking insects, a runaway lawnmower, and swooping bees along the way. A fun and heartwarming family film it is also preceded by a Roger Rabbit short adventure involving Baby Herman and a little medical mayhem in “Tummy Trouble”. Cast also includes Matt Frewer, Marcia Strassman, Kristine Sutherland, Thomas Brown, Jared Rushton.

results.title: Full metal jacket
results.creator_credit: Stanley Kubrick and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: Stanley Kubrick’s disturbing and darkly funny Vietnam war drama about the dehumanizing process involved in turning young men into trained killers is divided into two distinct acts. Based on Gustav Hasford’s “The Short-Timers”, the first part focuses on the slow descent into madness of a young recruit in basic training, Private Gomer Pyle (Vincent D’Onofrio). He undergoes a process of systematic torture, verbal abuse and cruel disciplinary measures administered by a sadistic drill Sergeant (Lee Emery). The second part shows the bastardization process in action as it follows Private Joker (Mathew Modine) as he navigates himself around the madness and senselessness of the Vietnam war. This isn’t the first time Kubrick has dealt with the inhumanities of war, having tackled similar themes in the brilliant ‘Paths of Glory’. With ‘Full Metal Jacket’ however, he achieves in presenting an absurd and chilling vision of hell on earth. Cast also includes Adam Baldwin, Arliss Howard, Dorian Harewood and Kevyn Major Hasford. Original music by Abigail Mead (Kubrick’s daughter Vivian Kubrick).

constellations_other.name: Hiding in plain sight
constellations_other.description: This print of upside-down heads is an early optical illusion featuring hidden characters. Movie studios have continued the tradition of playing with perspective in the bold designs, vivid colours and hidden meanings of film posters.

results.title: In the winter dark
results.creator_credit: James Bogle, Rosemary Blight, R B Films and Film Finance Corporation Australia
results.brief_description: Maurice Stubbs has a heavy heart, remorse and broken dreams consume him as someone or something is slowly killing the animals, disembowelling them in fact, around his secluded farm. His usual sense of total isolation is heightened by the inexplicable events that are occurring, and contradict the notion of an idyllic country existence. Maurice, along with his wife Ida and two other frightened residents, city fugitive Jacob and modern city girl Ronnie form an uneasy alliance in search of things they do not know, in places they should not be. For to confront the beast that seems to have no tangible existence is to confront their own internal demons. Based on the novel of the same name by Tim Winton. Cast includes Brenda Blethyn, Ray Barrett, Richard Roxburgh and Miranda Otto.

results.title: Head On
results.creator_credit: Jill Bilcock, Ana Kokkinos, Jane Scott and Head On Productions
results.brief_description: Ana Kokkinos’s debut follows the angry, confused and nihilistic 19-year-old Greek Australian, Ari (Alex Dimitriades) through 24 hours fuelled by drugs, booze and anonymous sex as he grapples with his sexuality and clashes with his traditional Greek family.

constellations_other.name: Ana Kokkinos
constellations_other.description: The films and TV works of Ana Kokkinos often explore the experiences of second-generation Australians, queer identities and class. Since beginning her career in the early 90s, those stories have started to appear more frequently on Australian screens.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Jill Bilcock, Ana Kokkinos, Jane Scott and Head On Productions
results.description:
Based on the novel Loaded by Christos Tsiolkas, Ana Kokkinos’s compelling debut feature Head On is a volatile, confronting and at times bleak look at race, sexuality and class in contemporary Australian society. The film’s lead protagonist Ari (Alex Dimitriades) is an angry, confused, nihilistic, unemployed 19-year-old Greek Australian. The film traces a particularly explosive 24 hours in his life, fuelled by drugs, booze and anonymous sex as he grapples with his sexuality and clashes with his traditional Greek family, who he views with equal amounts of respect and contempt. Performances are excellent throughout, in particular Paul Capsis as Ari’s defiant crossdressing friend Johnny/Toula.

Cast includes Elena Mandalis, Eugenia Fragos, Julian Garner, Dora Kaskanis, Alex Papps, Damien Fotiou. Awards: Best Actor (Alex Dimitriades) and Best Supporting Actor (Paul Capsis) for the 1999 Film Critics Circle of Australia Awards.

Best Feature Film Adaptation (Andrew Bovell, Ana Kokkinos, Mira Robertson) 1998 Awgie Awards.

Best Director (Ana Kokkinos) 1999 San Francisco Lesbian and Gay Film Festival.

Best Achievement in Editing (Jill Bilcock) 1998 AFI Awards.
description_for_label:

Performances are excellent throughout, in particular Paul Capsis as Ari’s defiant crossdressing friend Johnny/Toula.

Cast includes Elena Mandalis, Eugenia Fragos, Julian Garner, Dora Kaskanis, Alex Papps, Damien Fotiou. Awards: Best Actor (Alex Dimitriades) and Best Supporting Actor (Paul Capsis) for the 1999 Film Critics Circle of Australia Awards.
